name: Country Inn & Suites By Carlson Norman

reviews.text: Excellent location close to many restaurants. Nice shower, comfy beds, great breakfast. Extra pillows were happily provided upon request. Great ice machine. Will stay here again!
reviews.title: Comfy accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've lost track of how many Country Inn & Suites we've stayed in on this trip, having just discovered them on our 3rd night on the road. We weren't disappointed with the first one and we certainly weren't with this one: a warm, efficient greeting at the front desk followed by the joy of opening our door onto a lovely, large, well-furnished suite. Exceptionally clean, well equipped and comfortable, it's the kind of place a traveler is happy to "come home to". We were really impressed when, after we'd been in our room about 15 minutes, our in-room phone rang and it was the front desk calling to make sure everything was as we wished. How often does that happen? It simply made our day. The Welcome Bag of goodies in our room was a nice touch . And of course, the fresh-baked cookies at the front desk are always tempting. BTW: this chain really has nailed it with their breakfast offerings and the cleanliness of the space.
reviews.title: Continues the 5-Star Tradition!

reviews.text: Wonderful people working at the hotel. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. We got a great price too. Breakfast is adequate.
reviews.title: Great price, great people

reviews.text: We were in the Norman area due to an illness of a relative so needed a place that was close and affordable. This hotel worked well for our needs. Close to a sister in law and many restaurants. I would definitely recommend upgrading to a suite like we did if you are staying for several days. Gave us extra living space which was handy for relatives visiting and for the refrigerator and microwave. Several people have mentioned the small breakfast area and food qualaity but considering what you are paying the food was decent. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here in August 2010 and again in July 2011. When I checked in, Breanna remembered me from last year (the vacuum cleaners were broken last year and all the floors, including rooms, were yucky - a front desk person finally brought hers in from home and things changed.) She was very gracious and welcoming. My room wasn't fully made up; she and Mark made sure the missing items were stocked and did so pleasantly and quickly.
reviews.title: Front desk employees are this place's best feature!

reviews.text: Pluses: pleasant desk staff; clean room; decent bed; pretty good wifi connection; back from highway and external noises.
reviews.title: Below average hotel

reviews.text: Minuses: austere furnishings; room badly in need of painting (marks and stains on walls); abrupt, almost rude, breakfast staff; lots of room-to-room noise; lots of plumbing noise; tiny pillows; small, thin towels; industrial sheets; wifi required going to sponsored pages to access; spoiled milk at breakfast and slim pickings for breads (white bread, white bagels).
reviews.title: Tucked off the Interstate

reviews.text: Norman has lots of hotels within two miles of the Country Inn; I recommend you try the Hampton or the Hilton Garden Inn, both a little north of the Country.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: So use a GPS to locate it, BUT once you find it, you'll see it's close to many dining & shopping choices. Jason's Deli is in front, so you can walk over and get a great soup & sandwich.
reviews.title: Clean and convient

reviews.text: The beds are comfy (which is my #2 requirement, after clean = #1) and the staff are helpful. Hot breakfast, inside pool & spa all make for nice perks. Good guest laundry & workout equipment too.
reviews.title: Clean Rooms, Great Service

reviews.text: All hotels in Norman are high priced, but I think this one is a good value when comparing it to the others. I had a great room with a super comfortable bed. It is very quiet, and wireless internet works well. They have an indoor pool and hot tub. Breakfast was very good. Everyone I encountered there from the front desk clerks to housekeepers to the woman taking care of the breakfast room were very friendly and made sure everything was right with my stay.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: When I got there, they gave me a room that hadn't been cleaned, yet. I went back to the front desk and asked if I could wait there until it was ready. The clerk apologized and said she would find me another room. I am a Club Carlson silver member, so I asked if they had any upgrades and she upgraded me to a suite.
reviews.title: Good hotel in good location

reviews.text: It is right behind Carino's and I-Hop with Red Robin next to Carino's.
reviews.title: Good breakfasts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a pretty convenient spot in Norman, just off the interstate, but set back such that there isn't road noise. There are numerous restaurants within walking distance of the hotel (Carinos, Interurban, Jason's Deli). Breakfast was good, and coffee was actually decent (unlike at most hotels).
reviews.title: Hotwire Strikes Again

reviews.text: My only complaint is that the bed was exceptionally firm, which is not my preference.
reviews.title: A great place to stay.

reviews.text: We stayed at the County inn & suites for a total of four nights. The continental breakfast was always good and they never ran out of supplies. 24 hour coffee and cookies is a great idea and we definitely used it. County Inn has good size rooms and the air conditioning was definitely a life saver in the 100 degree + temperatures. Never used the pool though since we were visiting friends who have a backyard pool. The business center could use more than one computer though. Overall a great experience, will definitely recommend to friends.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great value for your money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a $53/night game for this place on Hotwire.com Check in was easy, the room was clean, the bathroom was very clean. The beds were just okay, but about what you would expect for this type of hotel. The lobby is very nice and is a cozy place to hang out. Breakfast is pretty good too. Our only beef with the place was the lack of promised cookies in the evening...after standing at the OU game for 6 hours we were STARVING and REALLY wanted one of those suckers! Didn't see any all weekend.
reviews.title: Great stay, but no cookies :(

reviews.text: I stayed 1 night at Country Inns. I checked into room 329 and I noticed dead bugs (roaches) on the bathroom floor so I immediately asked to be switched. I was switched to another room (#130) and there was the same problem. There were dead bugs on the bathroom floor, by the door jam and along the walls. Since they were dead I cleaned them up with toilet paper. It was too late to cancel and look for another hotel room. In the morning there were new dead bugs on the bathroom floor. One positive about this place - the woman at the front desk was siper friendly.
reviews.title: Dead Bugs in Room 329 and 130

reviews.text: My son and I were going to do a campus visit at the University of Oklahoma and needed a place to stay for one night. I called the hotel directly and asked if they had an OU visitors rate. They didn't, but the clerk taking the call knocked $20 off the base price of the room, making the rate a very nice one given how new and clean the place seemed. In fact, I think it is by far the nicest place I ever stayed for the price I got. The lobby was clean, inviting and warmly decorated. The room almost looked like it had just been remodeled. The bathroom was surprisingly spacious and also very clean. The closest to a complaint I could come up with is that there's no wired internet access (which I prefer for sensitive accesses like my bank) -- there is free wireless access, though. And there were two rather thick but small pillows -- one didn't elevate my head enough, and two were too much. Other than that, I would unhesitatingly recommend it.
reviews.title: Great deal for OU visitors!

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights and it met our needs of a comfortable and convienient place to stay. The staff was friendly and helpful when needed. Rooms were always clean and in order when we returned. My only suggestion is to work on the breakfast!. They really need to work on the hot item offering. Good restaurants within walking distance.
reviews.title: Met our needs.

description: With the modern décor, the convenient location and the thoughtful service offered at the Country Inn & Suites Norman, you'll wonder why traveling isn't always this easy. Close to Oklahoma City and Oklahoma University, this hotel features upgraded Suites and spacious Standard Rooms in Norman, OK. While staying with us, you’ll also appreciate excellent amenities, including a heated, indoor pool, a Fitness Center and a complimentary, hot breakfast.
